news.title: Trump orders India tariff hike to 50% for buying Russian oil
news.summary: India, which now faces among the highest tariff rates imposed by the US, called the levy "unjustified and unreasonable".

news.title: Trump says 'good prospect' of summit with Putin and Zelensky after envoy's Russia visit
news.summary: Expectations for a ceasefire between Moscow and Kyiv are muted, despite the US president's threat of sweeping sanctions.

news.title: Flights resume after Birmingham Airport emergency landing closes runway
news.summary: The plane has been removed, and Birmingham Airport's runway reopened shortly before 20:00 BST.

news.title: Reeves warned taxes must rise to cover Â£41bn spending gap
news.summary: The chancellor will miss her self-imposed borrowing rules without action, the National Institute of Economic and Social Research says.

news.title: On Ukraine's front line, twisted wreckage shows sanctions haven't yet stopped Russia
news.summary: In Kharkiv, investigators gather evidence of Russian attacks - and how it has dodged sanctions.

news.title: The secret system Hamas uses to pay government salaries
news.summary: Observers are baffled at how Hamas can pay officials as Gaza is isolated and largely reduced to rubble.

news.title: MasterChef returns with sacked hosts but without their jokes
news.summary: Gregg Wallace and John Torode were both sacked following a report into conduct on the BBC show.

news.title: Could RFK Jr's move to pull mRNA vaccine funding be a huge miscalculation?
news.summary: The US is withdrawing $500m for vaccines for diseases like flu and Covid. Health correspondent James Gallagher asks if it's the right call.

news.title: Wrong remains from Air India crash 'adds to trauma', says family
news.summary: Fiongal Greenlaw-Meek's sister tells BBC Newsnight her family are seeking closure and dignity for her brother.

news.title: British man arrested in US accused of trying to drown daughter-in-law in pool
news.summary: Mark Gibbon and his daughter-in-law argued about his grandchildren before he tried to drown her on a family holiday, Florida police say.
